BaziCalculator.title: Try the Bazi calculator and get your life decoded.
BaziCalculator.name: Name

HomeAbout.title: WHAT IS BAZI?
HomeAbout.paragraph1: Bazi, or 'Eight Characters,' is a traditional Chinese system that analyzes a person's destiny based on their birth date and time. It consists of four pairs of 'Top Stems' and 'Bottom Branches,' which represent the year, month, day, and hour of birth.
HomeAbout.paragraph2: Rooted in ancient Chinese philosophy and metaphysics, Bazi has origins that trace back over 3,000 years. The system provides insights into various aspects of life, including personality, relationships, career, and health, by examining the interactions of the Five Elements (Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, Water) and the balance of Yin and Yang.

HomeTraits.title: Traits of Five Elements
HomeTraits.metal: Metal: Thrives in structured, rule-based environments and values efficiency and justice.
HomeTraits.wood: Wood: Seeks growth, ideals, and breakthroughs, emphasizing creativity and progress.
HomeTraits.water: Water: Focuses on wisdom, adaptability, and navigating complex or changing situations.
HomeTraits.fire: Fire: Driven by passion, leadership, and inspiring others, with a strong sense of energy.
HomeTraits.earth: Earth: Values balance, reliability, and long-term stability, ensuring a solid foundation.
HomeTraits.findOut: Find out what type of person you are using our

metal.title: Metal (Righteousness)
metal.coreTraits: Core Traits: Firm, decisive, values rules and fairness.
personalityCharacteristics: Strengths: Strong sense of justice and responsibility, highly efficient, and excellent at making decisions. Clear judgment and logical thinking, suitable for solving complex problems.
Weaknesses: Too rigid and uncompromising, often struggles to adapt. Tends to see things in black and white. Emotional expression can be restrained or appear cold.
metal.typicalBehavior: Typical Behavior: Prefers to set rules and control situations, values order and whether others’ actions align with moral standards.

wood.title: Wood (Benevolence)
wood.coreTraits: Core Traits: Full of vitality, growth-oriented, and highly creative.
personalityCharacteristics: Strengths: Energetic, open-minded, compassionate, and persevering in pursuit of goals. Has clear ideals and a forward-looking mindset, enjoys helping others.
Weaknesses: Can be overly idealistic, impatient, and prone to emotional fluctuations. Sometimes ignores practical issues.
wood.typicalBehavior: Typical Behavior: Takes the initiative to handle pioneering tasks, seeks progress, and thrives on new ideas and experiences.

water.title: Water (Wisdom)
water.coreTraits: Core Traits: Flexible, intelligent, adaptable, and insightful.
personalityCharacteristics: Strengths: Emotionally intelligent, strong communication skills, quick to find solutions to problems, and highly intuitive. Adaptable and resilient.
Weaknesses: Can lack decisiveness, avoid pressure, or become overly dependent on others.
water.typicalBehavior: Typical Behavior: Skilled at using indirect approaches to solve problems, enjoys observing and analyzing complex relationships or the essence of things.

fire.title: Fire (Ritual)
fire.coreTraits: Core Traits: Passionate, energetic, and a natural leader who seeks light and truth.
personalityCharacteristics: Strengths: Radiates enthusiasm, enjoys sharing, and is full of hope for life. Inspires others and motivates teams effectively.
Weaknesses: Highly emotional and impulsive, may act without considering consequences. Can struggle with patience and deep reflection.
fire.typicalBehavior: Typical Behavior: Boldly takes on challenges, loves to be the center of attention, and drives themselves and others to achieve goals with their energy.

earth.title: Earth (Faith)
earth.coreTraits: Core Traits: Grounded, reliable, and focused on trust and stability.
personalityCharacteristics: Strengths: Provides a sense of security, values commitment, and is dependable. Calm under pressure and excellent at long-term planning.
Weaknesses: Overly cautious and resistant to change. May become too stuck in routines, missing out on opportunities.
earth.typicalBehavior: Typical Behavior: Focuses on maintaining the status quo, builds lasting relationships and foundations, and prioritizes practical results.

ServicesPage.title: Services
ServicesPage.description:
At Lab 8, we offer a variety of services designed to help you gain deep insights into your life's path using the ancient wisdom of BaZi (Chinese Astrology) and psychic guidance. Whether you're seeking clarity, personal growth, or a fresh perspective on your future, our services are tailored to empower you in achieving success and fulfillment.

Explore our services below.

PersonalReading.intro: Are you seeking guidance on your career, relationships, or other life challenges? Receive a personalized reading delivered straight to your inbox within one business day. Our service offers quick and insightful answers to your pressing questions, using time-honored Chinese methods.

steps.purchase: Purchase: Make your payment via PayPal, WeChat, or Alipay.
steps.email: Email Us: Send an email to xxx@gmail.com with your payment reference number or a screenshot of the transaction.
steps.prepareQuestion: Prepare Your Question: Meditate on your question for 3 minutes. Provide three integer numbers (between 1-999) along with your question. Optional: You can also include background information for a more thorough interpretation.
steps.restrictions: Restrictions: We do not address questions related to medical health, death, or legal matters.
steps.receiveAnswer: Receive Your Answer: Your reading will be emailed to you within one business day. Please check your spam or junk folder if you don't see it in your inbox.

PersonalReading.note: Note: This is a written service conducted exclusively via email. Your privacy is our priority—all readings are conducted with complete confidentiality.

AboutPage.title: About
AboutPage.intro: At Lab 8, the number '8' symbolizes both the 'Ba' (八) in BaZi and the infinity symbol (∞), reflecting our belief in the limitless potential within each individual. We are here to guide you through life's possibilities, helping you navigate challenges with clarity and wisdom.
AboutPage.baziExplanation: We utilize the ancient wisdom of BaZi, or the 'Four Pillars of Destiny,' to unlock a deeper understanding of your life's path, personality, and potential. BaZi is a Chinese metaphysical system that interprets universal energies through the interaction of the Five Elements (Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, and Water) and Yin-Yang forces, shaping your life experiences from birth.
AboutPage.birthChartIntro: Central to BaZi is your birth chart, a unique map based on the date and time of your birth. This chart is made up of four pillars, with each pillar consisting of a Top Stem and a Bottom Branch:

yearPillar.title: Year Pillar
yearPillar.description: Heavenly Stem: Represents the influence of grandparents or family elders, reflecting a person's family background and early environment. Earthly Branch: Reflects innate constitution and hereditary factors, symbolizing growth and foundations during adolescence.

monthPillar.title: Month Pillar
monthPillar.description: Heavenly Stem: Represents parents, leaders, or supervisors, symbolizing early career development and social status in adulthood. Earthly Branch: Reflects interactions with family and work environment, as well as life state and interpersonal relationships during middle age.

dayPillar.title: Day Pillar
dayPillar.description: Heavenly Stem: Represents the individual, directly reflecting the person's character and health based on its elemental attributes. Earthly Branch: Represents the spouse and marriage status, indicating partner relationships and family interactions.

hourPillar.title: Hour Pillar
hourPillar.description: Heavenly Stem: Symbolizes children, reflecting the relationship with them and predicting the state of later life. Earthly Branch: Represents a person's achievements and living environment in later years, reflecting later life fortunes and interactions with descendants.

AboutPage.fourPillarsSummary: In summary, the Year Pillar influences early life, the Month Pillar impacts middle age, the Day Pillar is closely related to the individual and marriage, while the Hour Pillar affects later life fortunes and relationships with children. Together, these four pillars form a person's BaZi chart, helping to interpret their life's fortunes, character, and significant events.
AboutPage.missionDescription1: At Lab 8, we are dedicated to helping you uncover your life's potential through personalized BaZi readings. With years of experience and deep knowledge of Chinese metaphysics, we offer clear guidance to help you live in harmony and happiness.
AboutPage.missionDescription2: Whether you're seeking clarity on a specific issue or a comprehensive understanding of your life's journey, we are here to support you with insightful interpretations and practical advice.
